name: meta
summary: The `<meta>` HTML element represents metadata that cannot be represented by other HTML meta-related elements, like base, link, script, style or title.

charset.name: charset
charset.summary: This attribute declares the document's character encoding. If the attribute is present, its value must be an ASCII case-insensitive match for the string "`utf-8`", because UTF-8 is the only valid encoding for HTML5 documents. `<meta>` elements which declare a character encoding must be located entirely within the first 1024 bytes of the document.

content.name: content
content.summary: This attribute contains the value for the http-equiv or name attribute, depending on which is used.

http-equiv.name: http-equiv
http-equiv.summary: Defines a pragma directive. The attribute is named `http-equiv(alent)` because all the allowed values are names of particular HTTP headers.
